channel.title: 3D Glasses
channel.description:
Anyone have any? What color? Red/Cyan seems to be the most popular, but I only have a few pairs Green/Magenta.
Curious, because I'm going to be making some 3D things soon.

item.title: 3D Glasses
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:9, topic:347753”]I order everything from this site, including these:

http://www.dealextreme.com/search.dx/search.3d%20glasses

Maybe find a pair that’s a bit more permanent than the ones you get at theaters.[/quote]

Cardboard glasses are better than plastic ones with acrylic lenses because the gel in them is stronger. Ghosting is more pronounced in the others.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Glasses

item.description:

item.title: 3D Glasses
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

RealD glasses are no good unless you have polarizing projectors set up.

Red/Cyan seems to be the majority.
I’ve read that Green/Magenta give better skin tones, but they’re barely used. They have come out for the DVD releases of Coraline, My Bloody Valentine 3D, and I think Journey to the Center of the Earth. We had them at work so I have a bunch, but I just ordered a pack of Red/Cyan.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Glasses
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

RealD 3D

RealD 3D is a digital stereoscopic projection technology made and sold by RealD. It is currently the most widely used technology for watching 3D films in theatres. Worldwide, RealD 3D is installed in more than 26,500 auditoriums by approximately 1,200 exhibitors in 72 countries as of June 2015. RealD 3D cinema technology is a polarized 3D system that uses circularly polarized light to produce stereoscopic image projection. The advantage of circular polarization over linear polarization is that ...

Read full topic
